page.title: 03Ecology: Woodland
page.content:
Just over 100 hectares of woodland remains in this area. Most is "ancient woodland", remnants of the old{Royal {Hunting Forest}of Essex. In the past, these forests were productive: growing {timber}for house construction and ship building and{coppice}poles for fences and firewood. Today they serve as public{open spaces}and two are{nature {reserves. {} Sample studies show 180 standard and 500 coppiced trees to the hectare:
Standard trees: Coppiced Trees: Silver Birch....40% Sweet Chestnut.49% Pedunculate Oak.30% Silver Birch...40% Sweet Chestnut..17% Others.........11% Hornbeam.........9% Others...........4%
